alert.note: Alert for Benton; Lafayette; Marshall; Pontotoc; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 11:12AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lafayette, Union, northwestern Pontotoc, southeastern Marshall and south central Benton Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1111 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bethlehem to near Burgess. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, New Albany, Holly Springs National Forest, Ecru, Cambridge, Keownville, Bethlehem, Etta, Burgess, Tula, Denmark, Pinedale, Thaxton, Hickory Flat, Myrtle, Abbeville, Taylor, Toccopola, Shari and Keel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
